content.description:
Climb a splitter finger crack on the face to a flake, then step left into a nice layback corner which widens as you get higher. A couple of bolts protect sections of suspect rock.

Should clean up well with some traffic.
content.location: Middle-left side of the wall, look for a splitter, arching finger crack to a bolt.

content.description: Romp up an easy ramp, then step into the arching corner. Stem your way through the wider, lower section, then finish on splitter hands to fingers. Might want to bring a #4 if this is at your limit.
content.location: Obvious large, right-facing corner on the far right side of the wall.

content.description:
Climb a splitter layback for about 15', move right, then move back left around a wide area. Continue up the hands to finger crack with small feet on the right face.

This route is listed in the Jackson guide as a 5.8, unknown name or FA. It's still pretty gritty and I thought it was more 5.9, maybe it will get easier an hopefully cleaner with traffic. I doubt anyone ever named it, so I gave it one.
content.location: Obvious hand-sized, splitter layback (well, the first 15' at least) in the middle of the wall.

content.description:
Nice face between "Enter The Dragon" and "Double Dragon" featuring long reaches between positive crimps and rails.

This is mostly an independent line, but is a bit close to both routes to deserve bolts. Easy to TR from "Enter The Dragon" anchors.
content.protection: TR only, use "Enter The Dragon" anchors.
content.location: Far right side of the wall.

content.description:
Follow a couple of flake systems to the right of a seam, then traverse left into the seam at the 4th bolt. Good warm-up for the crag.

This route was put up ground-up, on gear. Much of the gear was in hollow blocks or flakes, so we bolted it.
content.location: Bolted route, last route on the right side of the crag.
